title: Head lice and nits
localHeader: Head lice and nits are very common in young children. They donâ€™t have anything to do with dirty hair, and are usually picked up by head-to-head contact.

cards.caption: Head lice are small insects, up to 3mm long. They can be difficult to spot.
Close up view of a louse.
cards.alt: Close up view of a louse

cards.caption: Head lice eggs (nits) are yellow, brown or white (empty shells) and attached to the hair.
